item.title: Ergodicity and Insurance
item.description: I read this post on LinkedIn by Andreas Tsanakas that referenced a paper by Ole Peters titled Insurance as an Ergodicity Problem. It seems intuitive that an equal chance bet that would allow you to win 50% or lose 40% of the value of the bet would have a positive expected value, but in the long run such a bet will bankrupt you if you bet it all each time.
